terms.title: Opsian ID – Terms of Use
terms.section1Text: By using Opsian ID, you agree to these Terms of Use and our Privacy Policy.
terms.section2Text: Opsian ID is provided to help hotels verify guest identity using document scanning and facial recognition. The service is used solely for hotel check-in, guest registration, and related legal and security requirements.
terms.section3Intro: By using Opsian ID, you agree to:
terms.section3Item2: Only submit documents that belong to you and are valid.
terms.section3Item3: Not attempt to impersonate another person.
terms.section3Item4: Not interfere with, disable, or misuse the verification system.
terms.section4Intro: Opsian and the hotel reserve the right to:
terms.section4Item1: Deny check-in if your identity cannot be verified or fraud is suspected.
terms.section4Item2: Use verification results as part of internal security and compliance processes.
terms.section4Item3: Retain non-biometric verification records for audit and legal purposes.
terms.section5Text: While Opsian ID uses advanced AI and security measures, we do not guarantee that verification will always succeed. Technical errors, poor image quality, or other factors may result in failed or inconclusive verification.
terms.section6Intro: To the maximum extent permitted by law, Opsian and its technology partners are not liable for:
terms.section6Item1: Any indirect or consequential damages arising from the use or inability to use Opsian ID.
terms.section6Item2: Any actions taken by the hotel based on verification results, provided such actions comply with applicable law.
terms.section7Title: 7. Changes to the Service or Terms
terms.section7Text: We may update Opsian ID or these Terms from time to time. The latest version will be available on this page with an updated Last Updated date.
terms.section8Text: For questions about these Terms, contact:

privacy.title: Opsian ID – Privacy Policy
privacy.section1Text: This Privacy Policy explains how Opsian ID (we, us, or our) collects, uses, stores, and protects your personal data when you use our identity verification service.
privacy.section2Intro: When you use Opsian ID, we collect:
privacy.section2Item1: Identity Document Images: Photos of your passport, national ID, or driver's license.
privacy.section2Item2: Selfie Photo: A facial image used for biometric verification.
privacy.section2Item3: Verification Metadata: Information such as verification status, timestamp, room number, and guest name.
privacy.section3Intro: We collect and process your data to:
privacy.section3Item1: Verify your identity for hotel check-in.
privacy.section3Item2: Comply with local laws requiring guest registration.
privacy.section3Item3: Prevent fraud and ensure the safety of all guests.
privacy.section4Item1: Identity Verification: Your document and selfie are analyzed using AI to confirm your identity.
privacy.section4Item2: Record Keeping: Verification logs are stored for legal and audit purposes.
privacy.section4Item3: No Sale or Sharing: We do not sell, rent, or share your personal data with third parties for marketing purposes.
privacy.section5Item1: Encryption: All data is encrypted in transit and at rest.
privacy.section5Item2: Secure Servers: Data is stored on secure, compliant cloud infrastructure.
privacy.section5Item3: Access Controls: Only authorized personnel can access verification data.
privacy.section6Item1: Automatic Deletion: ID and selfie images are automatically deleted 30 days after capture.
privacy.section6Item2: Verification Logs: Non-biometric logs (e.g., guest name, room number, timestamp) are retained for up to 1 year for compliance purposes.
privacy.section6Item3: User-Requested Deletion: You may request immediate deletion of your data by contacting us.
privacy.section7Item3: Request deletion of your data (subject to legal requirements).
privacy.section7Item4: Withdraw consent at any time (though this may prevent completion of verification).
privacy.section8Text: We may use trusted third-party services (e.g., cloud storage, AI verification providers) to process your data. These providers are contractually obligated to protect your data and use it only as instructed by us.
privacy.section9Text: Opsian ID is not intended for use by individuals under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect data from minors.
privacy.section10Text: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. The latest version will always be available on this page.
privacy.section11Text: If you have questions or wish to exercise your privacy rights, contact us at:

dataRetention.title: Opsian ID – Data Retention Policy
dataRetention.section1Text: This Data Retention Policy explains how long Opsian ID stores your personal data and how we manage data deletion.
dataRetention.section2Item1: Retention Period: 30 days from the date of capture.
dataRetention.section2Item2: Automatic Deletion: Images are automatically and permanently deleted after 30 days.
dataRetention.section2Item3: Purpose: Temporary storage allows for audit, dispute resolution, and compliance with local regulations.
dataRetention.section3Purpose: Purpose: Legal compliance, audit trails, and security monitoring.
dataRetention.section4Text: You may request early deletion of your data by contacting us at hello@opsian.io. We will process your request within 30 days, subject to any legal obligations that require us to retain certain records.
dataRetention.section5Text: In some cases, we may be required by law to retain verification data for longer periods. If this applies, we will inform you and retain only the minimum data required.
dataRetention.section6Text: When data is deleted, it is permanently removed from our systems and cannot be recovered.
dataRetention.section7Text: For questions about data retention, contact:
